subject: Leadership
title: Managing Remote Teams
description: A micro-lesson that makes Managing Remote Teams usable.

hook.text: A fully remote team spans five time zones. They never meet in person yet ship faster than the office team.

buildup.text: Remote work removes hallway chats and spontaneous collaboration. Leaders must design intentional connection.

discovery.text: GitLab's all-remote handbook: document everything, default to async, and make decisions in writing.

twist.text: Remote teams don't fail from distance. They fail from isolation. Social rituals matter more when apart.

climax.text: Build trust remotely with regular one-on-ones, virtual social time, and over-communicating context and decisions.

punchline.text: Remote teams thrive on structure, not surveillance.

quiz.question: What is key to successful remote team management?
options: Requiring cameras on at all times
